bug.short_desc: Cache is not updated when removing a branch of a library - wrong error message

long_desc.thetext:
two libs:
qxe.theme.modern.Color
and in the
contrib://trunk
also
qxe.theme.modern.Color
then
./generate.py
gives
- Warning: Hint: Unknown global symbol referenced: qxe.theme.modern (cm.p.cm.re.theme.Appearance:15)
the error message here should be different like "namespace clashing has occurred: qxe.theme.modern" instead of the above.
then
the qxe.theme.modern and the directories are removed locally.
again
./generate.py
gives
- Warning: Hint: Unknown global symbol referenced: qxe.theme.modern (cm.p.cm.re.theme.Appearance:15)
this error message should not have been thrown because there is no reason to it except in the cache which means that the cache has not been synchronized!
then
./generate.py distclean
and again
./generate.py
no errors anymore
This is poor design as the developer needs to trust the generator that it is doing right.
Move open issues to RESOLVED â€“ LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
